problem_text:
19.29. Let Φ ∈ Out G = Aut G/Inn G. Two automorphisms φ, ψ ∈ Φ are said to be isogradient if φ = ĝ−1ψĝ for some inner automorphism ĝ. The number of isogradiency classes in Φ is denoted by S(Φ).
Conjecture: If a finitely generated residually finite group G has an outer automorphism Φ such that S(Φ) is finite, then G has a soluble subgroup of finite index.
A. L. Fel’shtyn, E. V. Troitsky
